These disorders are associated with neurodegeneration (common for Alzheimer's disease, Parkinson's disease, and senile dementia), atherosclerosis (cause of cardiovascular and cerebrovascular diseases), immune regulation (dysregulated in cancer, autoimmune, and chronic inflammatory diseases), and endocrine/metabolic dysfunction (imbalanced in diabetes and obesity).
